channel.title: Yell problem

item.title: Yell problem
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

Cause you used semicolons instead of nothing.

EDIT: Sorry Mitko

[code]if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5) {
String msg = command.substring(5);
if (muted)
sM(“You are muted therefore you cannot yell.”);
switch(playerRights) {

	DEFAULT:
	yell("[Player] "+playerName+" - "+msg);
	break;

	case 1:
	yell("[Mod] "+playerName+" - "+msg);
	break;

	case 2:
	yell("[Admin] "+playerName+" - "+msg);
	break;
} 
       if (donator == 1)
	yell("[Donator] "+playerName+" - "+msg);

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("namehere"))
	yell("[Co-Owner] "+playerName+" - "+msg);

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Kenneth"))
	yell("[Owner] "+playerName+" - "+msg);

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Yell problem
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“yell”) && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0) {
if (!muted) {
if (playerRights == 0) {
yell("[Player] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
} else if (playerRights == 1) {
yell("[Mod] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
} else if (playerRights == 2) {
yell("[Admin] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
}
else if (donator == 1) {
yell("[Donator] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“namehere”)) {
yell("[Co-Owner] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
} if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Kenneth”)) {
yell("[Owner] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
} else if (playerRights ==4){
yell("[Player] " + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5));
}

} else {
	sM("You are muted therefore you cannot yell.");
	}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Yell problem
item.dc:creator: @Southbird Southbird
item.description:
@Southbird wrote:

Okay, so I added this code:

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { String text = command.substring(5); if (muted == true) sM("You're muted and can't yell!"); if (playerRights != 1); yell("[Mod] "+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); if (playerRights != 2); yell("[Admin] "+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); if (playerRights != 3); yell("[Owner] "+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); if (playerRights != 4); yell("[Co-owner] "+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

I don’t get any compile errors, or anything. But the problem is, if you e.g. write “::yell Hello.” it says:
[Mod] Test: Hello.
[Admin] Test: Hello.
[Owner] Test: Hello.
[Co-owner] Test: Hello.

And it says that, both for moderators and owners, how do I fix it so when moderators yell, it says “[Mod] Name: Text.”, and when an administrator does, etc.?

Read full topic
